alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Johnson; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:39PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Johnson, northwestern Washington, southeastern Linn and southeastern Iowa Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 439 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over University Heights, or near Iowa City, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Tiffin around 445 PM CDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 230 and 248. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
